title: In what ways has the pandemic sped up the use of robotics, and in which industries is it occurring the most? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve helped engineer industrial robots. I doubt your assertion that the pandemic has sped the adoption of robotics. There are very few general-purpose industrial robots - most are custom made, and it is a very interactive process, which not amenable to being done during a pandemic. There tends to be an extensively iterative engineering process. There’s a lot of lead-time, typically a year or so. So, I would say only in areas where there is already at least one robot, because it’s much faster to build a second identical robot.
